data.title: Princess Charlotte of Belgium (1840
data.meta_description: Hermann was Franz Xaver’s younger brother and assistant as well as a painter in his own right, who had studied in Munich and Rome.Princess Charlotte (1840-1927) was the only daughter of Leopold, King of the Belgians. She was lively, attractive and intelligent as a child, adored by her father and much loved by her English relatives. In 1857 she married the Archduke Ferdinand-Maximilian of Austria. He was created Emperor of Mexico in 1864 but was executed in 1867. After her husband’s death Charlotte lived in...
